channel.title: Putty on TheKoguryo's Tech Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Putty on TheKoguryo's Tech Blog

item.title: 3.5.2 Connecting to PuTTY on Windows
item.description: 3.5.2 Connecting to PuTTY on Windows The SSH Key generated by the PuTTY Key Generator is stored as PuTTY Private Key (PPK) .ppk via Save private key and used by PuTTY. Keys generated by ssh-keygen in the Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) file format are available at PuTTY via PEM -> PPK conversion. Install PuTTY If PuTTY is not installed, download and install a putty from http://www.putty.org/ . Connecting a Linux Instance on Windows Run putty.

item.title: 3.5.3 Changing the PEM <-> PPK Format
item.description: 3.5.3 Changing the PEM <-> PPK Format Privacy Enhanced Mail (PEM) Generated via ssh-keygen command based on an earlier document in the key pair format used by an OCI instance PuTTY Private Key (PPK) The key format used by PuTTY, which is a format created by default when saved through PuTTY Key Generator PEM to PPK format conversion 1 . PuTTY Post-install Key Generator (http://www.putty.org/) 2. Run the PuTTY Key Generator.
